    News and Presentation-Building Resources

    Combining trusted news and time-saving resources.

    National Journal combines the trusted news content you've come to expect with time-saving and tools and policy data you can immediately fold into your work stream.

    Sample Our Resources

    What We're Following See More »
    AGREEMENT ON OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE
    House Ready to Drop Its Own Postal Reform Bill
    9 hours ago
    THE DETAILS

    The House Oversight and Government Reform Committee is close to releasing a draft version of its own postal service reform bill, which looks to be "smaller in scale than the bill in the Senate with bipartisan support." Ranking member Elijah Cummings (D-MD) said the House bill would likely omit items that could cause "heartache" on either side. A major component of postal reform would be to require employees to enroll in Medicare at retirement, rather than rely on the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program.

    Source:
    Latest News for You

    The House GOP’s Lawsuit Could Really Damage Obamacare—if it Keeps Winning

    Sam Baker

    Hotline's Quote of the Day

    “ I did my best to bring our party together, but I don’t know what the knuckleheads want. Still to this day I don’t know.”

    — — Former Speaker John Boehner (R-OH), at the SALT Conference in Las Vegas, CNN, 5/12.

    • Premium journalism from National Journal's respected editorial team with convenient summaries and deeper analysis.

    Leadership Council

    Expert intelligence to effectively navigate Washington.

    • Complete access to National Journal's preeminent editorial content, time-saving Presentation Center and Axis data hub.
    • Comprehensive tools to help you stay on top of the 2016 election cycle, including The Hotline, National Journal Daily, and a new digital Race Tracker.
    • Insightful research, custom content and exclusive gatherings that cover topics such as implementing a government affairs focused social media strategy, and creating a data driven advocacy strategy.

    Communications And Marketing Strategies Targeted insights and strategies.

    Targeted insights and strategies.

    National Journal Offers

    • Data driven research for effectively reaching Washington decision makers
    • Peer-to-peer briefings for senior staff of Washington's leading advocacy organizations.
    • Targeted advertising informed by individual client needs.

    Some Of Our Insights

    • In 2015, LinkedIn was the most adopted social media channel by Washington Insiders, used in the past six months by 79% of respondents.
    • Insiders consume on average seven different channels on any given weekday to get their Washington-focused news and information, including websites, e-newletters, social media, print, radio and TV.
    • 66% of Insiders expect to use their mobile devices more to do their jobs in the next 1-2 years.
    Topics for 2016

    Storytelling Strategies for Purpose, Promotion, and Advocacy

    Exploring key challenges and solutions for collecting, sharing, and measuring success of advocacy stories and establishing a sustained organizational culture that supports storytelling efforts.

    Topics for 2016

    2016 Washington in the Information Age

    Trends, data, and insights that allow communications professionals to pinpoint the specific media channels, content formats and timing to maximize reach and influence decision-making among policy insiders.

    Improve Your Communications Strategy Today.

    Receive a free preview of Washington in the Information Age and more information about effectively reaching Washington decision makers.

    National Journal Insights For Insiders
    National Journal is a research and insights company, building on Washington's most trusted media brand with decades of experience and an unmatched team in political research, comprehensive consulting and communication strategies. Our mission is to equip government and business leaders with the information, insights and connections they need to do their job more efficiently and effectively.
